Class AccountController

java.lang.Object
controller.AccountController
public class AccountController extends Object
Controller for the user account view. Displays user profile information, loads and filters the issues assigned to the user, and supports viewing individual issues from the table. Handles initialization of table columns and keyboard shortcuts.
Version:
0.2
Author:
Artur Twardzik

  • Constructor Details

    • AccountController

      public AccountController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the account view once its FXML is loaded. Configures table styling, enables editing, initializes all table columns, and registers a keyboard shortcut (Ctrl/Cmd + O) to open the selected issue.

    • initializeIssueTitleCol

      private void initializeIssueTitleCol()
      Configures the Issue Title column to display titles with tooltips and ellipsis when text overflows. Also enables double-click to open the issue in the main window.

    • initializeReporterCol

      private void initializeReporterCol()
      Configures the Reporter column to display the username of the issue's reporter.

    • initializeDueDateCol

      private void initializeDueDateCol()
      Configures the Due Date column to display formatted due dates, or "N/A" when no due date is assigned.

    • initializeStatusCol

      private void initializeStatusCol()
      Configures the Status column to display and allow editing of issue status via a combo box. Updates the underlying issue object on edit commit.

    • setParent

      public void setParent(MainAppWindowController parent)
      Sets the parent controller that manages the main application window.
      Parameters:
      parent - the main window controller to associate with this account view

    • setUser

      public void setUser(User user)
      Loads the user's profile information into labels, including username, name, roles, creation date, and last seen timestamp.
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose account information should be displayed

    • setUserIssues

      public void setUserIssues(List<Issue> userIssues)
      Sets and displays the list of issues assigned to the current user. Filters the provided list so that only issues assigned to this user appear in the table.
      Parameters:
      userIssues - a list of issues to filter and display
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if called before a user is assigned via setUser(User)
